p: In the spectrum of PNS involvement in COVID-19, we present the case report of a patient with confirmed SARS-CoV-2 infection who developed facial nerve palsy during hospitalization ( Figure 3). Despite that, RT-PCR in the CSF was negative for SARS-CoV-2 and direct infection of the nervous system could not be established, the temporal association between COVID-19 and facial nerve palsy is highly suspicious for an indirect, possibly immune-mediated mechanism.
